crypto.desc:
One time signatures, so you can spend your coins only once.

Please solve the task locally first and reach our server only for the flag :)

pwn.name: PainterHell
pwn.desc:
When I was very young, I made mods for various games. I think I was developing very secure plugins at the time. Can you check my old plugins?

BTW you don't need to exploit the TF2 game engine!

Hints:

    Sandbox setup info. We are only changing outside ports. All ports inside container are same like in task.zip. Our example sandbox docker-compose looks like:

    ports:
      - 27016:27015/udp
      - 27016:27015/tcp
      - 81:80

    Have you found the backdoor?
    Backdoor is connected somehow with django app.

pwn.name: qmail
pwn.desc: One of the internet leaders launched an anti-spam mail checking service. You send it an email content and you get an aggregated score from multiple systems. However, it seems that something broke as the service doesn't respond from time to time. Am I sending content in EMail Message format? A mistake on their part seems implausible.

rev.name: REmap
rev.desc:
Recently we fired our admin responsible for backups. We have the program he wrote to decrypt those backups, but apparently it's password protected. He did not leave any passwords and he's not answering his phone. Help us crack this password!

PS: Challange binary might trigger windows defender with a certain signature database version. It's a false positive, known for quite some time. If you google the signature name, you should be able to find GitHub issue explaining it. It's not malware, although we encourage you to run it on a separate VM.

rev.name: Rusty
rev.desc: Looking at Rust code in disassembler/decompiler hurts, so... look somewhere else.

rev.name: debug me if you can
rev.desc: I bet you can't crack this binary protected with my custom bl33d1ng edg3 pr0t3c70r!!!111oneoneone

rev.name: reklest
rev.desc: In our infrastructure it works perfectly but it takes time

rev.name: that is not crypto
rev.desc: This is very simple RE task, but you may need some other skills as well. :)

web.name: Go-fs
web.desc: We have implemented a fully featured file server in the Go programming language. Our code is bulletproof!
